ACBalancing 0.1.0

    • package_intro

    Hierarchically Regularized Entropy Balancing

    HRB.Rd

    Hierarchically Regularized Entropy Balancing is a approximate balancing method that expands the feature space by including higher-order terms of covariates while imposes ridge penalties with a hierarchical structure on the higher-order terms.

    HRB(
  covariate,
  treat,
  group1,
  group2 = NULL,
  outcome,
  alpha.space = c(0.1, 0.05, 0.01, 0.005, 0.001),
  iterations = 1000,
  convergence = 10^{
     -10
 },
  cv.fold = 5,
  second.moment = TRUE,
  third.moment = TRUE,
  interact = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    covariate

    covariates.

    treat

    treatment indicator.

    group1

    see Details.

    group2

    see Details, Default: NULL.

    outcome

    outcome.

    alpha.space

    alpha.space is

    iterations

    iteration time in optimization problem, Default: 1000.

    convergence

    Criteria for determining convergence of optimization problems. Default: 10^-10.

    cv.fold

    cv.fold is

    second.moment

    second.moment is

    third.moment

    third.moment is

    interact

    interact is

    Value

    a HRB object with the following attributes:

    • AT: the estimate of average treatment effect in group1 (i.e, \(E(Y(group1))\)).

    • weight: the estimated univariate balancing weight.

    • GMIM: Generalized Multivariate Imbalance Measure that defines in our paper.

    • MAE: Mean Absolute Error.

    • alpha: the tuning parameter we choose.

    Examples

    # estimating ATE
set.seed(0521)
data <- si.data()
X <- data$X
treat <- data$Tr
Y <- data$Y

result1 <- HRB(covariate = X, treat = treat, group1 = 1, outcome = Y)
result2 <- HRB(covariate = X, treat = treat, group1 = 0, outcome = Y)

# an estimate of ATE
result1$AT - result2$AT
#>           [,1]
#> [1,] -1.699096

# estimating ATC
result3 <- HRB(covariate = X, treat = treat, group1 = 1, group2 = 0, outcome = Y)

# an estimate of ATC
result3$AT - mean(data$Y[data$Tr == 0])
#>           [,1]
#> [1,] -1.875974
